Description: To resolve a Clean Air Act case, the company agreed to spend $337 million to reduce emissions, pay a $1.4 million civil penalty and spend $6 million on supplementary environmental projects.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2002/January/02_enrd_037.htm

Description: The Environmental Protection Agency and the Department of Justice announced a Clean Air Act settlement with PSEG Fossil LLC related to the company's failure to comply with a 2002 consent decree requiring installation of pollution controls at its coal-fired power plants in Jersey City and Hamilton, N.J. This new settlement included a $4.25 million payment to the federal government as well as additional air pollution reductions and tighter controls.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2006/November/06_enrd_801.html

Agency: Occupational Safety & Health Administration

Description: To resolve allegations that it failed to adequately prepare for Tropical Storm Isaias in 2020, PSEG Long Island agreed to to forfeit its 2020 incentive compensation of approximately $10 million and to use the proceeds toward compensating families and small businesses which lost food and medicine as a result of the extensive outages.
Agency: New York Public Service Commission
Info Source: https://www3.dps.ny.gov/pscweb/WebFileRoom.nsf/ArticlesByCategory/C189A09AA16C9541852585C90064BD7A/$File/gov_announces_corrective_actions_utilities_ts%20isaias_081920.pdf?OpenElement
